intro: Aulaya squamosa, commonly known as the scaly aulaya, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, scaly stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically ovate with a rough, textured surface. Aulaya squamosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
